  The Mongols have had really bad luck wh=
en trying to invade Japan a
  thunderstorm harassed north Kyushu island in =
1274 when the Yuan army
  was fighting (first invasion attempt), and again =
in 1281 a typhoon
  hit north Kyushu island while the Yuan soldiers were on=
 board their
  ships preparing for a major landing operation (second attemp=
t). In
  both instances the Yuan armies suffered severe casualties from the=
se
  natural calamities and the invasions were aborted. In my opinion if
  =
not for the "divine winds" the Mongols would of have a good chance of
  win=
ning.
  Just to give you some figures:

  First Invasion:
  Yuan army: 40,0=
00; with 900 ships
  Japanese army: 10,000

  Second Invasion:
  Yuan army:=
 140,000; with 4,400 ships
  Japanese army: 40,000
